definition: a flight maneuver, to have confidence or faith in
details:
noun
- a flight maneuver
= synonyms: slip
- a building in which the business of banking transacted
= example: a building in which the business of banking transacted
= synonyms: bank building
- a container, usually with a slot in the top, for keeping money at home
= example: a container, usually with a slot in the top, for keeping money at home
= synonyms: money box, savings bank, coin bank
- a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities
= example: a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities
= synonyms: depository financial institution, banking concern, banking company
- an arrangement of similar objects in a row or in tiers
= example: an arrangement of similar objects in a row or in tiers
- a long ridge or pile
= example: a long ridge or pile
- sloping land (especially the slope beside a body of water)
= example: sloping land (especially the slope beside a body of water)
- a slope in the turn of a road or track
= synonyms: camber, cant
- the funds held by a gambling house or the dealer in some gambling games
= example: the funds held by a gambling house or the dealer in some gambling games
- a supply or stock held in reserve for future use (especially in emergencies)
verb
- to have confidence or faith in
= example: to have confidence or faith in
= synonyms: trust, swear, rely
- to cover with ashes so to control the rate of burning
= example: to cover with ashes so to control the rate of burning
- to enclose with a bank
= example: to enclose with a bank
- to tip laterally
= example: to tip laterally
- to put into a bank account
= example: to put into a bank account
= synonyms: deposit
- to be in the banking business
= example: to be in the banking business
- to act as the banker in a game or in gambling
= example: to act as the banker in a game or in gambling
- to do business with a bank or keep an account at a bank
= example: to do business with a bank or keep an account at a bank
